item.title: PyTorch Frameworks
item.description: Catalyst API Runner Runner â€“ the logic of your deep learning experiment data model batch handling logic metrics monitoring systems. Callback The Callback API repeats main for-loops in our train-loop abstraction: on experiment start/end on batch start/end on stage start/end etc. Metric The Metric API. Logger Logger for metrics, images, hyper-parameters, etc. Can be connected with comet-ml and tensorboard. Engine The Engine sets how to run:

item.title: Space Navigator
item.description: TL; DR A system for calculating optimal collision avoidance maneuvers for satellites based on reinforcement learning. About We made Space Navigator - a system for automatically determining the probability of collision of space objects and calculating the most effective evasive maneuver using AI. Stage of the project: Research Article “Space Navigator: a Tool for the Optimization of Collision Avoidance Maneuvers” (2020) MVP (2019) First place in the competition of projects of the Academy of Roscosmos (presentation slides, 2018) VR presentation (2018) Demonstrations and reports:

item.title: DL useful stuff
item.description: – the post is in process – git git fetch git rebase git checkout git merge git pull tmux terminal: tmux # start tmux session tmux ls # list sessions tmux a -t <session name> # attach to the session called <session name> tmux kill-session -t <session name> # kill the session called <session name> pkill -f tmux # just kill all tmux windows commands: CTRL+b c Create a new window CTRL+b n Switch to the previous window CTRL+b p Switch to the next window CTRL+b w Choose window from a list CTRL+b , Rename the current window CTRL+b & Kill the current window panes commands:

item.title: Computer vision 3D stuff
item.description: Mesh formats .obj etc Metrics chamfer distance cross entropy loss in PyTorch torch.nn.functional.cross_entropy(input, target) input: predicted unnormalized scores shape: (C), or (N, C), or (N, C, d1, d2, …, dk) with K>=1 in case of K-dimentioanl loss. target: ground truth class indices or class probabilities shape: (), or (N), or (N, d1, d2, …, dk) with K>=1 in case of K-dimentioanl loss. where C â€“ number of classes; N â€“ batch size.

item.description: Exhibition “Game Junction” exhibition in the gallery Khodynka with For All Exists Infinity project. Some details Read more here.

item.title: Poker Robot
item.description: TL; DR Researching and applying the Reinforcement Learning approach to no-limit Texas poker. Fragment of one of the experiments. My role Application of existing models Implementation of the pipeline of experiments and comparison of models Development of architectural features of the poker environment experiments Experiments

item.title: Storage Digital Twin
item.description: – the project is in progress – TL; DR Digital Twin of the Data Storage System based on conditional generative models. Photo by benjamin lehman on Unsplash My role Generative models research

item.title: Marketing Robot
item.description: TL; DR Outsourcing R&D project for the Retentioneering company â€“ Reinforcement Learning for automatic budget management for advertising campaigns. We managed to create a quality MVP. NDA. Yandex Direct img. My team Me. Olga â€“ MEPhI graduate, postgraduate student of the Institute of Theoretical and Experimental Physics (ITEP) in elementary particle physics, machine learning specialist, programmer.. My role Searching for a client Management Programming (python) Environment Reinforcement Learning Simulator … Statistical analysis of approaches, selection and analysis of metrics

item.title: For All Exists Infinity
item.description: Description VR installation created with the Unreal Engine. Two actors coexist, you and AI, representing previous users. You are able to influence the virtual world, creating traces of presence or artistic images. These traces are a way of communication with artificial intelligence, through joint creativity you can explore the virtual space. You have no means of communication with your ally other than creation. How to behave in an environment where basic familiar communication methods are not provided?

item.title: ML-IDS
item.description: TL; DR A course on machine learning for scientists “Machine Intelligence, interdisciplinary perspective”. Platform: https://en.pelican.study/. My role Lectures and homeworks (python, pytorch-lightning) topics: Deep Learning foundations: Convolutional Neural Network, BatchNorm, etc. Computer Vision foundations: Image Classification, Transfer Learning, etc. AutoEncoders Normalizing Flows Anomaly detection Time series

item.title: Course: Atrtigitl
item.description: TL; DR Online Digital Art School Atrtigitl, 06.11.20 â€“ 29.01.21. About Artigit’l online residency is aimed at a wide spectrum of artists as well as those individuals working within the innovative digital realm. Today the art and digital worlds are inherently intertwined and are rapidly expanding through a variety of formats that encompass a diverse range of technologies and innovations. The ubiquitous use of personal cameras and the daily generation of video content has led to a gigantic shift within the digital visual landscape.

item.title: Anomaly Prediction
item.description: TL; DR Application of Neural Networks, Machine Learning algorithms, Reinforcement Learning and Natural Language Processing for Detection / Prediction of Anomalies in Storage Area Network by log data. Also, development and testing researched methods for improving Digital Twin of Storage Area Network, methods on chaotic systems, OpenAI Gym wrappers. Research Article “Online detection of failures generated by storage simulator” (2021) Research Article “SANgo: a storage infrastructure simulator with reinforcement learning support” (2020) Experiments and intermediate results Photo by Denny MÃ¼ller on Unsplash

item.title: Satellite Positioning
item.description: TL; DR Improving the prediction of the position of a space object using machine learning. About The project task â€“ build a model that would predict the position of space objects using simulation data. https://www.esa.int/Applications/Telecommunications_Integrated_Applications/Orbits Predicting the position of satellites is one of the most important tasks in astronomy. For example, information on the exact position of satellites in orbit is necessary to avoid extremely dangerous satellite collisions.

item.title: Course: Computer Vision (OTUS)
item.description: Photo by Runze Shi on Unsplash I took a course on Ð¡omputer Vision from OTUS (in Russian) from April 28 to September 25, 2020. The course was practical and covered Neural Networks and Deep Learning in the field of Computer Vision - from the basics to the latest frameworks and state-of-the-art scientific articles. Besides that, there were cool lessons about TensorRT and Server Inference. In addition, the interesting thing about this course was to learn from the experience of colleagues who use Computer Vision in different fields.

item.title: Speech: SMILES (ML school at Skoltech)
item.description: Participated in the international summer school SMILES â€“ The Summer School of Machine Learning at Skoltech from 16 to 21 August 2020. In the poster session, I talked about two “AI & Satellite Problems” projects that we were engaged at the Laboratory of Methods for Big Data Analysis at the National Research University Higher School of Economics. Below is the submitted poster and the certificate provide. Poster PDF Certificate PDF Post about Data Analysis for Satellite Tracking

item.title: Task creation: IDAO (HSE University ML Olympiad)
item.description: TL; DR Preparing the task for the IDAO 2020 Data Analysis Olympiad based on the Satellite Positioning project. About This year the online task is coming from astronomy. It is focused on building a model that would predict the position of space objects using simulation data. The task was given by Russian Astronomical Science Center (ASC) and adopted for the Olympiad by the Laboratory of Methods for Big Data Analysis (LAMBDA, HSE University).

item.title: Course: Generative Models School
item.description: Autumn School on Generative Models â€“ HSE University and Yandex autumn school on generative models.

item.title: Conference: Space debris
item.description: Participation in the conference “Space debris: fundamental and practical aspects of the threat” with the Space Navigator project. Moscow, Institute of Astronomy RAS and Space Research Institute RAS, 2019.

item.title: Hackathon: RL Hackathon, A!ONE
item.description: I participated in the Reinforcement Learning hackathon from MTS at the A!ONE conference. It was required to develop an agent for a slightly modified CarRacing-v0 OpenAI GYM environment.

item.title: Conference: IAA SciTech Forum
item.description: Participation in the international conference IAA SciTech Forum with the Space Navigator project. Moscow, RUDN, 2018.

Hi, my name is Leonid Gremyachikh. I am PhD student and Research Assistant at the Faculty of Computer Science ðŸ’» in the HSE University (Moscow, Russia ðŸ‡·ðŸ‡º), as well as a lead Machine Learning engineer in the Computer Vision field at Adalisk. My research interests include Deep Learning, Computer Vision and Reinforcement Learning. If you have questions or just want to get in touch, then feel free to contact me an email at lgremyachikh@gmail.
